newsitem.title: USA: Checkers extends default waivers to Sept 10.
newsitem.headline: Checkers extends default waivers to Sept 10.

text.p: Checkers Drive-In Restaurants Inc said it was still negotiating the restructuring of its $36 million debt with a new lending group and had extended default waivers again through September 10.
Checkers, whose outstanding debt was acquired by a capital management firm in July, had previously extended the waivers until August 30.
Rating agency Standard & Poor's replaced Checkers with A.M. Castle & Co on its SmallCap 600 Index on August 23 after the closing price of its stock had been trading consistently below $1.
